meanings.sent1: The old house was reclad with fresh paint.
meanings.sent2: The workers will reclad the building with new siding.
meanings.sent3: The superhero decided to reclad their costume for a fresh look.
meanings.sent4: She reclad her phone in a colorful case to protect it.
meanings.sent5: The knight reclad his armor before heading into battle.

meanings.definition: To provide with a new outer covering
meanings.sent1: The company decided to reclad the office building with modern glass panels.
meanings.sent2: The architect plans to reclad the skyscraper with energy-efficient materials.
meanings.sent3: The students wanted to reclad their school lockers with fun stickers.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar will soon reclad itself in a cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The car owner chose to reclad the vehicle in a shiny metallic wrap.
